alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 3:26PM MST until August 26 at 5:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR NAVAJO COUNTY... At 324 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has ended across the warned area, from near Hotevilla to just south of Pinon. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain fell earlier this afternoon. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hard Rock, Hopi Reservation, Navajo Reservation, Kykotsmovi Village and Hotevilla. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 363 and 367...and between mile markers 372 and 375. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Oraibi Wash, Polacca Wash, Burnt Corn Wash, Wepo Wash and Dinnebito Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
